duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide operational leadership and support to CMC-PM team members, ensuring achievement of key business and program deliverables against global development plan milestones.
Act as a key senior level liaison in the interactions between Regeneron and corporate partners, preparing and providing input for major presentations for collaboration meetings.
Facilitate and drive decision making in support of the joint strategic objectives of the program, representing Regeneron’s interests.
Keep the Senior Director, Strategic Alliances and CMC Program Management and IOPS Senior Management informed of all major alliance activities and issues.
Develop and facilitate achievement of strategic team operational project milestones, and support through active and consistent leadership, alignment with department operational objectives.
Monitor ongoing progress of key results against global development plan achievements, including the identification of potential risks and contingency plans.
Act as a key resource for direct reports and business on matters related to CMC PM, ensuring effective, accurate, and timely communication across functional areas within Regeneron.
Interact with Senior Management on cross-functional team matters/issues, influencing the overall objectives and long-range milestones of the CMC Program.
Adept at leading multiple projects/tasks simultaneously, switching between tasks quickly, and juggling competing priorities and projects.
Understand resources, portfolio requirements, and align accordingly. Develop tools and mechanisms for monitoring progress and problem solving with CMC project and functional area managers.
Define and document working/standard processes that can be used across other CMC projects with all relevant departments to ensure efficient product supply to patients and the business.

education_certification.credential: BS/BA required and 14+ years industry experience. PMP certification or MBA a plus.
